summary:
After having completed a PhD in Structural Geology in 1991, I started working in the Oil &Gas industry where I have developed experience through a wide range of positions from Exploration via R&D and Business Planning to Production & Development.

I love to integrate across discipline interfaces and lead teams in a focused manner to key business decisions and improved performance/delivery.

I have implementing LEAN thinking in our organization. In the Onshore Development Team (some 100 staff) the application of LEAN methodologies has significantly accelerated business opportunity maturation and improved product quality.

As manager for new energy solutions (with a strong focus on geothermal energy) in our organization I am now fully involved with the societal and technological discussions on a sustainable energy future in the Netherlands. A successful energy transition and CO2 reduction implies that everybody will continue to have access to reliable, dependable and affordable energy. This can only be achieved through an integrated transitioning approach involving both fossil fuels and sustainable sources. In addition to the technological challenges, this debate strongly hinges on societal acceptance and the strategic decisions the players in the energy industry take. 


Specialties: Structural Geology
Risk/Decision Analysis
Economic Evaluation
Field Development Planning
Strategy
Change Management
Leadership
LEAN
New Energies
Energy Transition
Geothermal Energy

profile_positions.description: Support both public and private enterprises in realising and accelerating the energy transition. Focus areas are heat transition projects (both for industry and build environment) as well as supporting clients with CCS and Hydrogen projects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Energy Transition

profile_positions.description: Jointly with two colleagues (@Raymond Franssen, @ Manuel Willemse) co-develop and lead hands-on course where student teams compete to develop one subsurface structure for three alternative uses: geothermal, carbon storage or oil/gas. The focus is on field development, economics, stakeholder- and project-management as well as appreciating the technical skills required for each
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Lead a digitalization project to improve deployment of subsurface analogues and benchmark data to prevent optimism and overconfidence of revenues and value in major Capital Investment
profile_positions.title: Project Lead Subsurface Analogues and Benchmarking

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the development of geothermal projects with as primary focus The  Netherlands. Build a license/activity portfolio, supporting consortia and financing (including subsidies) and work towards first project execution in 2021.
profile_positions.title: Development Manager Shell Geothermal BV

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Developing and Realising New Energy projects. Key themes: CCS, E-Hubs (re-purposing exisiting gas infratsucture) Geothermal, Energy Storage (heat/Hydrogen). Established Shell Geothermal BV
This is done in parallel to NAM's core business of producing domestic gas, the cleanest fossil fuel available in the Netherlands.
